alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 1:19PM CDT until May 04 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Washita County in western Oklahoma... Custer County in western Oklahoma... Southern Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Dewey County in northwestern Oklahoma... * Until 200 PM CDT. * At 119 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Corn, moving northeast at 40 mph. A second severe storm was located east of Foss moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Thomas, Arapaho, Custer City, Foss, Greenfield, Oakwood, Putnam, Fay and Stafford. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
